meanings.definition: To make something, especially fabric, untidy or wrinkled.
meanings.sent1: She was rumpling the paper as she tried to fold it neatly.
meanings.sent2: The wind was rumpling the leaves on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept rumpling the clean laundry.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds were rumpling the calm surface of the lake.
meanings.sent5: The child's hands were rumpling the sandcastle they had just built.

meanings.sent1: The fabric started rumpling after being crumpled in the bag.
meanings.sent2: His shirt was rumpling as he moved around the room.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat was rumpling as he pulled out a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: Time's passage rumpled the once smooth surface of the pond.
meanings.sent5: The old book's pages were rumpling from years of use.
